results.title: History lesson
results.brief_description: A song in the folk idiom about a history lesson illustrated with newsreel footage of recent historical events such as the first atomic bomb, Hitler, Nazi rallies, Neville Chamberlain, scenes of poverty in Asian countries, and the Vietnam War.

results.title: History in action
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: History, when viewed with hindsight, has the aura of inevitability. This series reviews key events of the 20th Century and examines the reaction to these events as they actually occurred. Each programme uses original material such as newspapers, photographs, archival footage, cartoons and music to enhance the contemporary feel.

results.title: History brought to life. King of kings
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille, Pathé Frères and Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
results.brief_description: History brought to life (9 mins) hosted by Cecil B. DeMille unfolds the glory of early Hollywood and its massive industry at work, providing a dazzling array of stars and historic milestone film events. “King of kings” (1927-112 mins) acknowledged as the definitive film of Jesus, presents the story of Christ as a moving portrait seen through the eyes of Mary Magdalene.

results.title: History & styles of rock music in Australia
results.creator_credit: Euan Mitchell, Sylvie Leber, John Foss, Australian Contemporary Music Development Co (AUSMUSIC) and Serious Business
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic music industry skills”.
Introduction to the Music Industry. Module 4.1. A fascinating look at the development of Australian rock music from its humble beginnings during Johnny O’Keefe’s “Wild One” days in the mid 1950’s, the struggles to gain recognition at home and overseas in the ‘60’s and ‘70’s to the international success of Australian acts in the ‘80’s and the diversity of styles in the ‘90’s. Through personal accounts, photographs and music video clips we examine, decade by decade, the music styles, fashions, changing technology and trends in Australian rock music including legendary performers such as The Easybeats, Russell Morris, AC/DC, Skyhooks, Cold Chisel and Midnight Oil.
results.title_for_label: History & styles of rock music in Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: Euan Mitchell, Sylvie Leber, John Foss, Australian Contemporary Music Development Co (AUSMUSIC) and Serious Business

results.title: Historical marine paintings by Richard Linton
results.brief_description: Richard Linton was born in Melbourne in 1935. He began working in photolithography after studying at the Australian School of Printing. His first serious painting of a sailing ship was in 1957. His love of history and meticulous attention to detail make him a world authority on the subject and unique in today’s art world. With his knowledge of printing he also produces limited edition prints of his works. In this video, Richard Linton explains his working process, including researching and painting, and talks about his paintings of Australian and overseas built sailing ships.
